channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Retirees Will Get a Smaller Social Security Raise in 2025---and That's OK
item.description: Next year’s cost-of-living adjustment is expected to be 2.6% as inflation cools.

item.title: ‘I don’t want to be unfair’: My mother gave me $150,000 to buy a house. One sibling wants 15% ownership. What now?
item.description: “I do not want to be unfair to my siblings, but I also do not want them to own an interest in my house.”

item.title: A Recession Signal Is Flashing Red. Or Is It?
item.description: When the yield curve turns positive, the country is usually about to plunge into recession. Hope this time relies on a few historical exceptions.

item.title: History shows Wall Street analyst estimates can be 30% too high at the peak, which one strategist says may be now
item.description: Wall Street earnings expectations assume profit growth will continue despite signs of the economy rolling over, says strategist.

item.title: Campbell Drops Soup From Its Name, Not Its Plans
item.description: While the company is rightly emphasizing new growth drivers, its core soup business could still surprise.

item.title: GameStop stock sinks after sales fall, 20 million share stock offering
item.description: GameStop Corp. shares fell more than 10% in after-hours trading Tuesday after the videogame retailer surprised investors with a quarterly profit, but ...

item.title: The Rise and Fall of a Green-Energy Superstar
item.description: Enviva cashed in on a boom in wood pellets, then a disastrous trade led to bankruptcy. Questions have been raised about the industry’s environmental c...

item.title: The market has pronounced a winner from Tuesday’s debate, and it’s Kamala Harris
item.description: Financial markets early Wednesday were moving in a way consistent with reduced likelihood of a second Donald Trump presidency.

item.title: Goldman's Credit-Card Exit Hampered by Lax Lending Standards
item.description: The bank lent loosely on some credit cards, contributing to a big loss as it tries to sell the General Motors card business.

item.title: European Central Bank to cut interest rates again as inflation and economy cools
item.description: The ECB is expected to trim borrowing costs as its focus shifts from damping inflation to supporting the bloc’s faltering economy.
